wikipedia_page.main: James Bonar, known as Jim Bonar, ( 1866 – unknown) was a Scottish footballer who played in The Football League for Accrington.Jim Bonar started his football career in Renfrewshire in 1883. He joined a club called Thornliebank who had reached the Scottish Cup final three years before. Jim Bonar made his League and Accrington debut on 8 September 1888 at Anfield, the then home of Everton. Accrington lost the match 2–1. Jim Bonar appeared in 17 of the 22 matches played by Accrington in 1888-1889 season. As a forward he played in a forward line that scored three League goals or more on seven separate occasions.

response: J. Robertson was a Scottish footballer who played in The Football League for Accrington. Jim Bonar had not scored since he played the opening League game on 8 September 1888, so was dropped and Robertson replaced him at inside forward. Robertson made his debut at Thorneyholme Road, Accrington, against Burnley. All went well and Accrington won 5–1 but Robertson did not score. The next 2 games were lost and drawn and Robertson did not score so he was dropped and never played League football again.
